description.compact: A simple API extension for DateTime

property.value: int $timestamp seconds since the Unix Epoch
-read integer $weekOfYear ISO-8601 week number of year, weeks starting on Monday
-read integer $daysInMonth number of days in the given month
-read integer $age does a diffInYears() with default parameters
-read integer $quarter the quarter of this instance, 1 - 4
-read integer $offset the timezone offset in seconds from UTC
-read integer $offsetHours the timezone offset in hours from UTC
-read boolean $dst daylight savings time indicator, true if DST, false otherwise
-read boolean $local checks if the timezone is local, true if local, false otherwise
-read boolean $utc checks if the timezone is UTC, true if UTC, false otherwise

docblock.description: Please see the testing aids section (specifically static::setTestNow()) for more on the possibility of this constructor returning a test instance.

comment.value: If the class has a test now set and we are trying to create a now()

description.compact: Create a Carbon instance from a DateTime one

Create a carbon instance from a string. This is an alias for the constructor that allows better fluent syntax as it allows you to do Carbon::parse('Monday next week')->fn() rather than (new Carbon('Monday next week'))->fn()

Create a Carbon instance for the greatest supported date.
Create a Carbon instance for the lowest supported date.
Create a new Carbon instance from a specific date and time.

docblock.description:
If any of $year, $month or $day are set to null their now() values will be used.
If $hour is null it will be set to its now() value and the default values for $minute and $second will be their now() values. If $hour is not null then the default values for $minute and $second will be 0.

description.compact: Create a Carbon instance from just a date. The time portion is set to now.
Create a Carbon instance from just a time. The date portion is set to today.
Create a Carbon instance from a specific format

Create a Carbon instance from an UTC timestamp

Set weekend days

Set a Carbon instance (real or mock) to be returned when a "now" instance is created. The provided instance will be returned specifically under the following conditions: - A call to the static now() method, ex. Carbon::now() - When a null (or blank string) is passed to the constructor or parse(), ex. new Carbon(null) - When the string "now" is passed to the constructor or parse(), ex. new Carbon('now')

docblock.description:
Note the timezone parameter was left out of the examples above and has no affect as the mock value will be returned regardless of its value.
To clear the test instance call this method using the default parameter of null.

description.compact: Get the Carbon instance (real or mock) to be returned when a "now" instance is created.

return.description: the current instance used for testing

description.compact: Determine if there is a valid test instance set. A valid test instance is anything that is not null.

return.description: true if there is a test instance, otherwise false

description.compact: Determine if there is a relative keyword in the time string, this is to create dates relative to now for test instances. e.g.: next tuesday

return.description: true if there is a keyword, otherwise false

comment.value: skip common format with a '-' in it

description.compact: The number of seconds since midnight.
The number of seconds until 23:23:59.
Get the difference in a human readable format in the current locale.

docblock.description:
When comparing a value in the past to default now: 1 hour ago 5 months ago
When comparing a value in the future to default now: 1 hour from now 5 months from now
When comparing a value in the past to another value: 1 hour before 5 months before
When comparing a value in the future to another value: 1 hour after 5 months after

param.description: removes time difference modifiers ago, after, etc

comment.value: Some langs have special pluralization for past and future tense.

description.compact: Resets the time to 00:00:00
Resets the time to 23:59:59
Resets the date to the first day of the month and the time to 00:00:00
Resets the date to end of the month and time to 23:59:59
Resets the date to the first day of the year and the time to 00:00:00
Resets the date to end of the year and time to 23:59:59
Resets the date to the first day of the decade and the time to 00:00:00
Resets the date to end of the decade and time to 23:59:59
Resets the date to the first day of the century and the time to 00:00:00
Resets the date to end of the century and time to 23:59:59
Resets the date to the first day of week (defined in $weekStartsAt) and the time to 00:00:00
Resets the date to end of week (defined in $weekEndsAt) and time to 23:59:59
Modify to the next occurrence of a given day of the week.

docblock.description: If no dayOfWeek is provided, modify to the next occurrence of the current day of the week. Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.

description.compact: Modify to the previous occurrence of a given day of the week.

docblock.description: If no dayOfWeek is provided, modify to the previous occurrence of the current day of the week. Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.

description.compact: Modify to the first occurrence of a given day of the week in the current month. If no dayOfWeek is provided, modify to the first day of the current month. Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.

Modify to the last occurrence of a given day of the week in the current month. If no dayOfWeek is provided, modify to the last day of the current month. Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.

Modify to the given occurrence of a given day of the week in the current month. If the calculated occurrence is outside the scope of the current month, then return false and no modifications are made.

docblock.description: Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.

description.compact: Modify to the first occurrence of a given day of the week in the current quarter. If no dayOfWeek is provided, modify to the first day of the current quarter. Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.

Modify to the last occurrence of a given day of the week in the current quarter. If no dayOfWeek is provided, modify to the last day of the current quarter. Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.

Modify to the given occurrence of a given day of the week in the current quarter. If the calculated occurrence is outside the scope of the current quarter, then return false and no modifications are made.

docblock.description: Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.

description.compact: Modify to the first occurrence of a given day of the week in the current year. If no dayOfWeek is provided, modify to the first day of the current year. Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.

Modify to the last occurrence of a given day of the week in the current year. If no dayOfWeek is provided, modify to the last day of the current year. Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.
Modify to the given occurrence of a given day of the week in the current year. If the calculated occurrence is outside the scope of the current year, then return false and no modifications are made.

docblock.description: Use the supplied consts to indicate the desired dayOfWeek, ex. static::MONDAY.

description.compact: Modify the current instance to the average of a given instance (default now) and the current instance.
Check if its the birthday. Compares the date/month values of the two dates.

param.description: The instance to compare with or null to use current day.
